note.p: Birth: Stockport, near Manchester, Cheshire, England (27 or 29 November 1849)
Death: Cambridge or Manchester, Lancashire (04 December 1934)
Buried: St Giles' cemetery, now Ascension Cemetery, Cambridge
Education: Owen's College, Manchester; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1872), MA

Career: Fellow and Assistant Tutor, Trinity College, Cambridge (1872-1875); Professor of Mathematics, University of Adelaide (1875-1885); Professor of Mathematics, University of Manchester (1885-1920)
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1932-1935 vol l pp 375-391, plate, by A E H Love and 391-392 by R T Glazebrook
References: John G Jenkin, 'The Appointment of W H Bragg, FRS, to the University of Adelaide' in NR 1985-86 vol 40 pp 75-99
R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
Notes: ON and DSB give birth date as 29 November 1849. DSB gives place of death as Manchester; DNB gives Cambridge
